sentence.Network_en: The comic skIt'sent up the foolishness of young men in love.

sentence.Network_en: They performed a skit to amuse the crowd.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (in the sense 'satirical comment or attack'): related to the rare verb skit 'move lightly and rapidly', perhaps from Old Norse (compare with skjóta 'shoot')

entry.tran: (采用模仿手法的)滑稽短剧，幽默讽刺小品
entry.def: A skit is a short performance in which the actors make fun of people, events, and types of literature by imitating them.

example.tran: 巧妙地讽刺了流行歌曲的滑稽短剧
